Sometimes you can calm people down by just talking or listening to them.  This is one of the few times I've had such a hostile response; usually they have at least some curiosity and you can use it start talking to them and trying to get them to realize how much their words can hurt others.

That's literally a federal crime actually, so you could report it to the FBI if you want to. I'm not saying you should, but you could. A big company like Riot is no doubt aware of just how much a serious legal matter sending death threats online actually is so they'll probably act upon it.

Thank you!!! Bookmarked it! I plan to read it after my class.

Quick question, do I have to worry about the legal lawyer? (if you don't know, it's ok! I will look it up after the class!)

You don't need a lawyer to report a crime, you would only need one if you plan to pursue a civil suit. But make sure to be 100% truthful since making a false report or providing false information in a criminal report is a serious crime.

Also the link I provided is for internet crimes only, if it's a IRL threat you should contact your local police instead.
Yes. Screen shot it and submit a support ticket under general questions
You can send the unedited pic to support in a ticket.
Submit a ticket if it is a private message

I assume after the game he gave you a friend invite? you accepted and he ambushed you with the threat?

That what they all do "Hope you have cancer" was one i got along time ago.

To answer, technically you can't report him on the client, you would have to send a support ticket and include the unedited screen shot.

it's harassment and unacceptable behavior based on the summoners code.
